intro: Fragmosa aspera, commonly known as the rough fragmosa, is a shrub native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and dark green, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
